content.rendered:
What is a Mechanical Engineer?

Mechanical Engineers plan and design tools and mechanically functioning equipment–often in the heat, gas, and water fields. They also tend to oversee the operation, installation, and maintenance of these products.

Where does a Mechanical Engineer work?

  • Engineering firms
  • Architectural firms
  • Manufacturing companies

How much does a Mechanical Engineer make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Mechanical Engineer is $64,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Mechanical Engineers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Mechanical engineering majors
  • Electrical engineering majors
  • Engineering majors
Search Mechanical Engineering jobs on Handshake

Mechanical Engineer skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Mechanical Engineers succeed in their work:

  • Creative mindset
  • Great math skills
  • Analytical and problem solving oriented way of thinking

What are some common questions about Mechanical Engineers?
